segment.tokens: V HOW KATY DID Never did trout cookies maple sugar never such appetites
never such laughing such interesting stories told by the guide
" Chic-a-chee chic-a-chee over over again " answered Jack
Probably Mr. Katy like other good husbands in the world is singing of the wonderful things Katy did do and the naughty things she did n't do
Ah he finds Mrs. Katy very charming her beautiful wings her gracefully waving antennæ her knowing shining eyes
Katydid carries its musical instrument at the base of its wing cover
On each side is a tiny membrane a strong vein
When the wing covers are rubbed together
the guide had lighted half a dozen
The children scurried off certain of a quick victory
In the woods about the cabin you could hear them shouting " "
" A will-o the-wisp " murmured the old man " "
they never have a harder one to find
They could n't find the katydid in any place
He took one of the lanterns
He went to a near-by tree
He held the lantern to the leaves
The children trooped into the cabin after him
crowding to look at the katydid
See you ca n't tell this fellow from the leaf
" it is such a bright fresh
if it were this bright green
how easily the birds would find them
What nice salad Katy would make for a young robin "
they have n't any stated luncheon supper time doing it
One time is as as another the oftener the merrier
If Katy does n't keep very quiet demure
and Father Robin Mother Bluebird has a meal for the youngsters "
that why it does n't sing by day
waving its long fine silky antennæ about
Probably it 's trying to find out
looking out for another nice green leaf to eat
They do a lot of damage eating leaves from the trees "
pointing to the edge of a leaf
" Mrs. Katydid has laid her eggs there
each egg laps a little over the one in front of it
Once another man saw a row of katydid eggs
could be on the edge of a clean linen collar
then in the spring the young ones will hatch out
They will grow their skins from time to time just the way
Ah they leave so many old clothes
that they need an old clothes man
I could tell you about the katydid
I knew once upon a time who spent her days collecting old clothes
how she made a fortune to
I ca n't tell that to you
Mr. John Burroughs is a wiser old
Lately the scientists almost killed one man a good clever useful man telling that story very savage very savage "
